title:
Scale-dependent anisotropy, energy transfer and intermittency in
  bubble-laden turbulent flows

tables.caption: Parameters of the cases used for the present study according to <cit.>. The labels BiDisp(Sm) and BiDisp(La) denote the results for the bi-disperse case, BiDisp, where averaging has been restricted to small and large, respectively. Here, N_p is the number of bubbles, α_b is the bulk void fraction, d_p the bubble diameter, Ar≡|ρ^G-ρ^L|gd_p^3/ρ^Lν^2 the Archimedes number. The values of Re_p, the bubble Reynolds number based on d_p and the bubble to fluid relative velocity, as well as C_D the drag coefficient, are obtained from the DNS.

Parameters of the cases used for the present study according to <cit.>. The labels BiDisp(Sm) and BiDisp(La) denote the results for the bi-disperse case, BiDisp, where averaging has been restricted to small and large, respectively. Here, N_p is the number of bubbles, α_b is the bulk void fraction, d_p the bubble diameter, Ar≡|ρ^G-ρ^L|gd_p^3/ρ^Lν^2 the Archimedes number. The values of Re_p, the bubble Reynolds number based on d_p and the bubble to fluid relative velocity, as well as C_D the drag coefficient, are obtained from the DNS.
